page.title: 07DELL QUAY
page.content: People visit Dell Quay to{fish, {sail,eat,drink}and appreciate the {spectacular views}of the South Downs. Dell Quay used to be a port. Nowadays there are boat building and repair yards, sailing and fishing clubs. It is a very popular and busy place during the summer. Boats can only navigate as far as Dell Quay.The creek is surrounded by{reed beds which are suitable for thatching. The creek is a{wildlife sanctuary which contains many species of both resident and migratory birds. It is popular with{ornithologists}for watching waterfowl.It is mostly mud at low tide,but sea walls have been built to protect adjoining farmland.Streams feeding the creek rise in{springs above the millpond.Some are used for the local{water supply.
